intro: Imeria serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Imeria serratifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
